TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CompilerError extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a compiler error or warning.

remarks.format:
## Remarks CompilerError represents a compiler error or a warning that has been returned by the compiler.
> [!NOTE] > This class contains an inheritance demand at the class level that applies to all members. A <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> is thrown when the derived class does not have full-trust permission. For details about inheritance demands, see [Inheritance Demands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9).
## Examples The following example compiles a CodeDOM program graph and provides an example of how to programmatically access CompilerError data.
[!code-cs[Classic CompilerError Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.codedom.compile_5_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic CompilerError Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.codedom.compile_5_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic CompilerError Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.codedom.compile_5_1.cpp)]

Docs.permission: for deriving from the CompilerError class. Demand value: ; : .

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public CompilerError (string fileName, int line, int column, string errorNumber, string errorText);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string fileName, int32 line, int32 column, string errorNumber, string errorText) cil managed

Docs.param: The file name of the file that the compiler was compiling when it encountered the error.
The line of the source of the error.
The column of the source of the error.
The error number of the error.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified file name, line, column, error number, and error text.
Gets or sets the column number where the source of the error occurs.
Docs.value: The column number of the source file where the compiler encountered the error.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Column property can be set to zero for compilers that do not return column information.

Docs.returns: The column number of the source file where the compiler encountered the error.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the error number.
Docs.value: The error number as a string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ErrorNumber property can contain a string of any length.

Docs.returns: The error number as a string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text of the error message.
Docs.value: The text of the error message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ErrorText property can be a string of any length.

Docs.returns: The text of the error message.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the source file that contains the code which caused the error.
Docs.value: The file name of the source file that contains the code which caused the error.
Docs.returns: The file name of the source file that contains the code which caused the error.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the error is a warning.
Docs.value: if the error is a warning; otherwise, .
Docs.returns: if the error is a warning; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the line number where the source of the error occurs.
Docs.value: The line number of the source file where the compiler encountered the error.
Docs.returns: The line number of the source file where the compiler encountered the error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides an implementation of Object's <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> method.
Docs.returns: A string representation of the compiler error.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is supported so <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError> objects can be treated as objects for simplified debugging output.

Docs.value: A string representation of the compiler error.
